Text.Value: Using something that's already fabricated is tough, but I can try. How many do you have?
It's perfect, really. Just a moment - I'll be able to work this one quickly.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
[Start of Line]: Player passes object to Dammon. He inspects it (only if we can convey this without showing the object since design needs to be able to iterate it)

[End of Line]: Dammon turns to his forging equipment and does some, uh, general forging. Shouldn't show weapon specifically and can be handled with a generic.
(CINEMATIC DUPE OF N86)
EditorData.SFXTags: [WLZX]  Foley on Dammon hammering weapon sound

Text.Value: I've got this metal I found in Avernus itself - will that do?
I think I found a material you could work with. What can you make of it?

EditorData.InternalNodeContext: Player has special hellish metal in inventory

Text.Value: If you want me to have another look, you know where to find me.
There you are. And be careful who you show that to. It might draw the wrong kind of attention.
Leave.
Thank the gods! I should've known you'd make it to the city all right, but you never know.

EditorData.NodeContext: Friendly, glad to see the player

Text.Value: Well, well, well... I knew I smelled something. And I know just what to do with it. One moment.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Dammon] recieves something while delivering line, turns to forge and then returns it to the player <Greg>, , *REUSE* [Player] CINE_ProduceInventory_StandL_01-03 <Lili>

(CINEMATIC DUPE OF N115)
EditorData.SFXTags: [WLZX]  Foley on Dammon hammering weapon sound

Text.Value: I'm Dammon. You helped me and mine out of a few scrapes - first with the druids, then at Last Light Inn.
Perhaps you've misplaced it? I'll be here should you find it again.
Without you, I'd be dead in a ditch twice over. Instead, I have my own smithy in the city. At least, until the Absolute's army mows us down.
I found this metal in a place called Grymforge - what do you make of it?
There. Be careful who sees you using that, might draw the wrong sort of eyes.
What can I do for you?
I'm shocked by my good fortune, quite honestly. Rent is fair, and the setup is just what I need to start making a living again.
Merregon masks are brittle, so what I make won't last as long as my usual pieces.

EditorData.SFXTags: [WLZX]  Foley on Dammon hammering weapon sound

Text.Value: But hey. Anything could happen in the meantime. Optimism, right?
I found some hellish masks, can you make anything of these?
I've got three masks.
I've got nine masks for you.
Of course. Wouldn't be alive to hold 'em if it weren't for you.
Hm. I thought I sniffed a Merregon's scent somewhere. These must've been a pain to get a hold of.
Here's one mask.
Hey now - I know you. You probably don't know me though.
Here's six masks I don't need.
That's not as many as you said you had.
Fair enough, they might have use as they are.
Could I take a look at your wares?
Actually, I'll hang on to them.
Nice workshop you have here.
I owe you. Maybe I can repay you with some metalware - finest in the city, if you don't know where to look.
I can spare two.
Absolutely. Rare to get your hands on this stuff - well done keeping it to hand.

Synopsis: Dialog from Dammon in the Act3, when we meet him while in his shop.
